meta.intended_use: LLM context + query generation seed for weekly market-signals tracker
meta.confidence_note: Competitor lists and carve-out profiles below are heuristic starting points; validate with internal SilverTree owners and/or each company’s positioning.

global_guidelines.primary_goal: Surface weekly, decision-useful signals for a PE fund: what happened, why it matters, portfolio impact, and whether a carve-out or add-on opportunity exists.
ignore_sources_global: job boards (unless executive departures/appointments confirmed elsewhere)
generic vendor blogs / SEO content farms
press-release syndication mirrors (use the original issuer)
affiliate review sites with no primary reporting
webinar/event promos with no product or commercial announcement
minor awards lists with no commercial implication

strong_positive_signals: seller is conglomerate/strategic doing portfolio pruning
target has distinct product lines, geographies, or customer segments with separate P&L
integration complexity or overlapping suites suggests parts may be redundant
buyer is private equity roll-up platform (often rationalizes portfolio)
strong_negative_signals: target is single-product, tightly integrated platform with shared infrastructure
transaction is distressed rescue with heavy operational entanglement
target is regulated utility core system with high switching cost and bespoke deployments (carve-outs harder)
highly bespoke services-heavy business with limited transferable IP

company_owned: company newsroom/press pages for each portfolio company
deal_and_corporate_actions: PE/IB advisories press pages (e.g., GP Bullhound, Arma, William Blair equivalents)
business registries / filings where relevant (Companies House for UK entities)
regulatory announcements relevant to sector (fincrime/AML, utilities market rules)
industry_trade_press: FinCrime/KYC: The Paypers, Finextra, GlobalComplianceNews-style outlets
Utilities/CIS: Utility Week, Energy Live News-style outlets, vendor-neutral analyst blogs
Enterprise architecture: CIO.com/enterprise IT trades, architecture community newsletters
Higher ed SIS: UCISA news, HE sector trades, procurement frameworks
market_intel: G2/Gartner-style category movement signals (used carefully; mostly for competitor discovery)
public procurement portals for education/utility contract wins
earnings call transcripts for strategic buyers (when relevant)

notes: LinkedIn sources are excluded for now.

minimum_context_to_add_per_company: top 3 ICP segments (by size and geography)
top 3 strategic risks (suite bundling, churn vectors, regulatory risk, delivery capacity)
known 'must-watch' acquirers (strategics + PE platforms) in the category
carveout_prompt_additions: Ask explicitly: 'Which division/product line/geography is most likely non-core to the buyer/seller and why?'
Force a separation feasibility checklist: data, people, contracts, infra, customer comms, regulatory, and delivery obligations
Require a 'what would SilverTree do with it' one-liner: bolt-on, platform add-on, or stand-alone carve-out

testing_metrics_suggestions.precision_proxy: share of items that Romil marks as 'useful' after review
testing_metrics_suggestions.coverage_proxy: count of true positives found vs a manual benchmark week
testing_metrics_suggestions.false_positive_rate: items dropped after human review / items sent
